metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26976 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
When a HTTPS pages was embedded in a HTTP page, and there was a serviceworker registered for the former, the service worker could have interceptedthe request for the secure page despite the iframe not being a securecontext due to the (insecure) framing. This vulnerability affects Firefox <84.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
